byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Maher Samaan contributed reporting from Paris, and Anne Barnard from New York.
byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Syrian Army claims to have liberated Palmyra from Islamic State militants, who had occupied historic city for almost one year and destroyed many ancient sites; retaking earns Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad rare international praise for his antiterrorism efforts.
lead_paragraph: The end of the ancient city’s nearly yearlong occupation brought a rare measure of international praise for President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.main: Syrian Troops Said to Recapture Historic Palmyra From ISIS
headline.print_headline: Syrian Army Claims It Fully Recaptured Historic Palmyra From ISIS

snippet: The end of the ancient city’s nearly yearlong occupation brought a rare measure of international praise for President Bashar al-Assad.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
